abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the EC-TF for Health Sector
            Reform Project for Philippines were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately unsatisfactory: risk to global environment
            outcome was moderate; bank performance was moderately
            unsatisfactory; and borrower performance was moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: (i) use of
            country systems in national program support operations to
            ensure ownership and continuity of reforms; (ii)
            strengthening results and policy focus of national program
            support; (iii) increased capacity building to ensure that
            decentralized services respond to supply and demand; (iv)
            strengthening  Monitoring And Evaluation (M&E)
            focus;(v) the need for monitoring and sharing of information
            to make a useful contribution to mainstreaming  improvements
            of healthcare delivery; (vi) strengthening central-local
            relations, particularly in promoting the introduction of
            national programs ; and  (vii) in the process of devolution
            for a country like the Philippines, third party verification
            should also comprise performance and management audits to
            better inform and resolve issues of implementation.
